she's here in New York City.

So if you think it's bad at home,
believe me it's much worse to be cold and hungry
and alone on the streets.

Push, push.

I give you the opportunity to practice it,
I want to use Asia, and now you do a cartwheel,
you stop, then you move forward and do a back handspring.
What was going on?

speaker: ABBY
text: Thought you were going to fall off the stage?
I really want Mackenzie to do it because she was part
of the original award winning number,
but Melissa has to learn that she doesn't get her cake and eat it too.
And Asia is just raring to go.
Bigger, Paige. When it gets hit, when the car hits the impact,
you need to levitate out of that car.
Like if you-- if the seat that would be holding you in,
you need to boom.
It's bigger, like that your butt up out of the seat almost.
Go.
Paige, you're doing this.
The wheels there.
Don't, don't.
Bigger, sharper.
I'm embarrassed as a teacher.
I'm sitting over here and it's like I'm humiliated.
I mean, come on.
This is The View.
All right, let's go guys.

speaker: KRISTI RAY
text: Asia's fine, but she did practice it,
but you keep going back and forth with Abby about getting
Kenzie in the dance, and--

speaker: MELISSA GISONI
text: Yeah, I should.
I'm sticking up for my kid.

speaker: KRISTI RAY
text: But I'm sticking up for mine too.
That's fine.

speaker: KRISTI RAY
text: Because she's mature enough to understand,
but also it keeps being an issue in her face.
And then you have Jill chiming in and everyone chiming in.
That is what's not fair.
I have Melissa here crying about Mackenzie going on.
Asia is fine with whatever, but let's just get it over with,
and let's just say who's going on stage,
so I don't have the peanut gallery here in the corner
talking madness on Asia.

speaker: CHRISTI LUKASIAK
text: Didn't you already talk to Abby?

speaker: MELISSA GISONI
text: At the studio.
Because you were really upset, and now you're like kind of--

speaker: MELISSA GISONI
text: I'm ti-ti-ti-ti-di. I'm still upset.

speaker: CHRISTI LUKASIAK
text: No, you're not.
I'm not going to do it in front-- my kids are here,
Christi, and we're on The View.
So we're happy to be on The View, OK?
If Mackenzie is not it, Mackenzie is not in it.
No, but I think that you know--
I want Mackenzie- I do not know.
- CHRISTI LUKASIAK: I think you know. - No I don't.

speaker: CHRISTI LUKASIAK
text: I think you do know, Melissa.
- MELISSA GISONI: I don't know. - Why don't you ever just like--

speaker: MELISSA GISONI
text: Because I don't know that Mackenzie is in it or not.
I want her in it. She's been on this team for years.

speaker: CHRISTI LUKASIAK
text: No, nobody's saying that.
What I'm calling you out on is the fact
that you always do stuff behind everybody's back.

speaker: MELISSA GISONI
text: Oh, OK.
You do, you do.
She doesn't know, and neither do I. That's what--

speaker: KRISTI RAY
text: I just wish that you would stop going, OK,
Abby is Mackenzie--
- MELISSA GISONI: Why? - Because she's my daughter.
I have to fight for my daughter.

speaker: KRISTI RAY
text: It's like this whole big charade about this foot,
all I keep hearing is about this foot, and I'm like OK--

speaker: MELISSA GISONI
text: I'm not bringing it up. The foot's done.

speaker: KRISTI RAY
text: Let Abby pick and be done with it.
Let it die.

speaker: HOLLY FRAZIER
text: Unfortunately, Melissa dug herself a hole.
Melissa said from the very beginning
that Mackenzie was injured, and how Melissa initially framed
it sounded like we didn't know when Mackenzie was going to be
well enough to dance again.
It was like an indefinite injury.
I think the point is, is that Melissa is the one who made
such a big deal about the foot, and she couldn't do it
if it was competing against Asia in a competition.
Now that it's for The View,
all of a sudden Mackenzie's miraculously better.
Oh, please. Give me a [bleep] BREAK.
I wanted Mackenzie to dance last week, Christi.
OK.
It's an overuse injury, Christi, get it.
It's not a broken bone.

speaker: CHRISTI LUKASIAK
text: I get it, but you're the one who made it
into a huge thing!
I mean, what else am I supposed to do?
I mean, I want my daughter to dance, I'm sorry.
But she's, you know, she's on the team.
I want her to dance.
I want Mackenzie to dance.
She's ready to dance.
When we're in our hotel room, all she does
is dance, and practice, and stretch.
She is ready.

speaker: KRISTI RAY
text: Melissa, you're acting like a jealous mom.

speaker: MELISSA GISONI
text: No! No, I'm just saying.
What was that--
Careful.
She doesn't like that it's happening to someone else.
I'm trying to explain, but you don't let me [bleep] talk.
I'm telling you--

speaker: KRISTI RAY
text: You need to be clearer, because--

speaker: MELISSA GISONI
text: I'm talking!
So I can understand you.
I'm not talking.
Kristi, look at you!

speaker: KRISTI RAY
text: Here in person, I was just--

speaker: ABBY
text: Fabulous.

speaker: KRISTI RAY
text: Thank you.

speaker: ABBY
text: I want to be like that when I grow up.
She looks great.
Who's is going to be in the dance?
I'm not sure yet if Asia or Mackenzie are doing the dance.
Mackenzie already got to do it, and she's been hurt,
and it's, you know, I'm kind of getting
that she was hurt because she didn't want to go up against Asia.
So I need to go, I need to get into hair and makeup.
That's show business, ladies.
Have them ready.
- OK. - OK

speaker: JILL VERTES
text: There they are!
The stars of the day!

speaker: HOLLY FRAZIER
text: Abby said by the time she comes in here,
she wants you dressed and ready, so be nice and warmed up.
For the most part, Melissa is very guarded
and not letting you see how upset she is that Asia
is basically taking over Mackenzie's role.
I mean, I think there's a perception
that Mackenzie's space, or her place on the team,
is a little threatened by Asia.

speaker: MELISSA GISONI
text: Oh, don't, don't do that again, Kenz.
No more doing that, OK?
Just leave it.

speaker: KRISTI RAY
text: This is life.
It's not always fair, right?
So, whatever she decides, we're going to go with it.
If you're not in the dance,
You kn- I know you're mature enough to understand.

speaker: MELISSA GISONI
text: You know, most likely you're not
going to be in the dance, OK?
So don't get upset.
No pouting, no crying, OK?

speaker: KRISTI RAY
text: That's how it is, right?
OK, so, you just watch and be happy, and hope the group just does really well.
If you're in it--

speaker: MELISSA GISONI
text: It is what it is.

speaker: PRODUCER
text: Sherri's going to talk about a shout out
to her ex-husband, complimenting him,
which we talked about in Hot Topic.

speaker: ABBY
text: Yeah, I get the last word there.
- You love that. - I love that.
Postal Service fashions.

speaker: ABBY
text: Co-hosting The View is huge.
I mean, I'm a dance teacher from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
And here I am dealing with Oscar winner Whoopi Goldberg?
This is crazy.

speaker: WHOOPI GOLDBERG
text: Today, our guest co-host week
continues with Abby Lee Miller.

speaker: CHRISTI LUKASIAK
text: The fake smile is killing me.

speaker: JILL VERTES
text: No, I told you.
I told you she would be on her best, charming behavior.

speaker: CHRISTI LUKASIAK
text: She'll be on cloud nine.

speaker: WHOOPI GOLDBERG
text: Abby, listen to me.
You're thought to be a tough teacher.
I am tough.
I think that there's a way to coach, and there's a way not to coach.
I don't think you can necessarily
break a kid on field if they feel supported at home, right?

speaker: ABBY
text: There's a child and I could say, honey,
when your foot comes through, so cou-de-pied into passe,
you need to open your hip and tuck your derriere under.
One time, very nicely, [snap], it's fixed.
Another kid, you have to yell at them until you're blue in the face.

speaker: HOLLY FRAZIER
text: I'm a little surprised.
It seems as though that most of the hosts really like Abby.
Like she has a fan club on The View.
All right girls, we're ready for you.
Do what you got to do. This is your moment.
You're on national TV.
- CHRISTI LUKASIAK: Make it count. - Make it count.
Millions are watching.

speaker: HOLLY FRAZIER
text: Break a leg, all of you.
Who's going to dance? Asia? Mackenzie?
I have no idea.
Ready, ladies?

speaker: ABBY
text: Ready, girls? Shoulders down, long necks.
So, Elisabeth leads, dance performance, and then you
and all the hosts will come in at the end, say goodbye.
The girls look great.
They're serious, they're acting like seasoned professionals.
I'm thrilled with their behavior.
All right.
This is my decision.
You are going to do the number.
You are coming out with me at the end.
- ABBY LEE MILLER: Understand? - Yes.

speaker: ABBY
text: The next time you're hurt,
I go to the doctor with you.
- Understood? - Yes.

speaker: ABBY
text: Because I think your mother is lying.
Let's go.
I put Mackenzie in The Last Text,
because three different times I told Asia where she needed to fall,
she kept doing it wrong.
Wrong gets you tossed out.

speaker: ELISABETH HASSELBECK
text: Here to perform The Last Text,
please welcome the dance troupe from the Abby Lee Dance Company.

speaker: CHRISTI LUKASIAK
text: When Mackenzie pops up from behind the seat
in The Last Text, all is well in Melissa's little world.
Look at her foot. You see her foot up?
I never noticed her doing that before.

speaker: KRISTI RAY
text: Personally, I knew this was going to happen,
but Abby's going to go ahead and take loyalty over talent.
That's fine.

speaker: KELLY HYLAND
text: I'm not surprised that Mackenzie ended up
doing this dance at all.
I think that Abby knew all week
of who she was going to have do this dance.

speaker: MACKENZIE ZIEGLER
text: As soon as I did my cartwheel over the seat,
I was like, I'm back.

speaker: ABBY
text: Co-hosting The View, that's a dream come true.
But right now, I only have one thing on my mind,
and that's beating Cathy.

speaker: CATHY NESBITT-STEIN
text: This group number is going to be stupendous.
- I think that the girl that we chose-- - Yes, she was--
--she's going to be perfect for what we want her to be.
With the fact that Abby has seen my all boy team
for the past couple of competitions,
I think that bringing in somebody that has the qualities
that Victoria has is definitely going to throw them for a loop.
Well, listen, you know yesterday I had an audition.
So I needed somebody that was really going to enhance you.
So, we found a girl.
You know, I like to do the unexpected
when it comes to Abby.
She's going to think because of last time
when we did so amazing that we're going to have all boys.
So now we bring in this girl that she doesn't know who the girl is.
- Hi - ALL: Oh.
Wow!
- RICK TESTERMAN: Are you tough? - Oh, yeah!
Because you've got to be tough to be on this team.
We don't take no mess.

speaker: CATHY NESBITT-STEIN
text: They're expecting the all boys,
and here we're going to come in with this beautiful girl,
who is not only beautiful, but a great dancer.
And and it's probably going to rock their world.

speaker: ANTHONY BURRELL
text: And you, unfold.
You, unfold.
You, unfold.
You, unfold.
Six, seven and a eight.

speaker: ANTHONY BURRELL
text: Lay back, Brandon.
Put your head on her.

speaker: CATHY NESBITT-STEIN
text: The Day of the Dead happens after Halloween,
and it's a Mexican holiday.
And it's a very jubilant time with lots of garish face painting,
lots of over-the-top costuming.
So I think that this theme is a good thing for us,
and it's going to be a lot of fun to take to the stage.
So guys I don't think it was clear.
It's like Zack is pushing it, you're going like this.
Five, six, then you're doing seven and a eight.
OK? That wasn't completely clear.
It is clear. You just got to open your mind and brains,
and stop being so closed-minded.

speaker: CATHY NESBITT-STEIN
text: Easy.
Six, seven, eight and--

speaker: CATHY NESBITT-STEIN
text: Victoria's a technically sound dancer
and she's very pliable with the boys.
The boys are having a very easy time with her in partnering.
How are you feeling, Victoria? Comfortable? Good.
Boys, it's a match!
It's match made in heaven.
- ABBY LEE MILLER: Hey hey. - Hi.

speaker: JILL VERTES
text: There she is.
- ABBY LEE MILLER: Hello! - Good job.
Oh, and you're all in a good mood because Mackenzie danced.
- And I told her-- - MELISSA GISONI: Yes, thank you.

speaker: ABBY
text: -- the next time either one of your kids go to the doctor,
I'm going, because I think you're lying to me.
I'm not.

speaker: ABBY
text: Well, that's just-- I'm just saying.

speaker: MOMS
text: Oh, hey!
Good job, you guys--
-- did she tell you not to listen to me?
Go tell Abby.
You tired? I see somebody yawning.
- MACKENZIE ZIEGLER: No, I'm not tired. - Everyboby's up since four.
I've been up since 6:05.

speaker: KENDALL VERTES
text: Of course Asia's not tired.
I'm never tired.

speaker: ABBY
text: She isn't.
She's ready to go.
There's nothing wrong with a little healthy competition.
Yes, you should want to turn like Asia,
and you should want to do your acro tricks like Mackenzie.
That's the way it has to be, you know?
She just got off being in a major competition show.
And she lives in California, there's a million opportunities for her
to do.
So you need to learn from that, and take that.
- Yes? - Yes.
She's a very mature seven-year-old.
All right girls, great part of the day, but it's over.
It's another thing on your resume, excellent.
But now, we need to concentrate on the competition this weekend.
Let's get focused, get ready, review what you had yesterday
so you're ready to go on.
I told you before, I'm not going backwards.
I'm not correcting things you learned yesterday.
We need to move ahead.

speaker: ABBY
text: Next on Dance Moms.

speaker: ABBY
text: Do not embarrass me with Cathy.
Do not embarrass me in New York.

speaker: KRISTI RAY
text: Look at me when you talk to me.

speaker: CHRISTI LUKASIAK
text: I'm looking you in the eye, bitch.
Bitch? Let's go.
Step out of my face. I have a kid--
You want to see me in your face?
He has anger issues and he better stay away from us.
Kick you right in the [bleep] [bleep]...
What the hell's wrong with you? Crazy.

speaker: CATHY NESBITT-STEIN
text: And you know what? You're going to go down every week.

speaker: ABBY
text: You were ripping on Paige.
You said she should give it up and go model.
I heard it.

speaker: KELLY HYLAND
text: You're not her dance teacher so don't give her critique. (CRYING)
You humiliated her in front of an entire [bleep] audience.
